headline: T-Mobile, Li Auto, Semtech: Market Minute
summary: Julie Hyman takes a look at some of today's top stories in this segment of Market Minute. T-Mobile (TMUS) was downgraded by Citi to Neutral from Buy, with its price target unchanged at $268. Chinese electric vehicle (EV) maker Li Auto (LI) reported a decline in fourth quarter net income and missed delivery estimates. The company also issued first quarter guidance that fell short expectations. Meanwhile, Semtech (SMTC) shares surge after the company beat on revenue and earnings in the fourth quarter and issued a better-than-feared outlook. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Top Stock Movers Now: Ulta Beauty, Crown Castle, Docusign, and More
summary: U.S. equities took off at midday as it appeared Democrats in the Senate would join Republicans in approving a spending plan that would prevent a government shutdown.

headline: Citi downgrades T-Mobile to Neutral on elevated valuation, lack of catalysts
summary: Investing.com -- Citi analysts lowered their rating on T-Mobile US Inc (NASDAQ:TMUS) stock to Neutral from Buy while maintaining the price target at $268. The telecom giant's shares fell 1.8% in premarket trading Friday.
